bioghist.p: John M. Weiss was born in Pennsylvania on March 11, 1885. After receiving his Bachelor of Science degree at the University of Pennsylvania, he became a chemical engineer. In 1905, Weiss began his career with the Barrett Company as a research chemist. By 1921, he was the Director of Development for the company. In 1923, Weiss began a 19-year stint as the president and treasurer of Weiss and Downs, Inc., a chemical engineering consulting firm. In 1943, he established John M. Weiss and Company. He was a senior partner of this company until his death in 1963. His primary interests included acids, maleic anhydride, and synthetic phenol.

scopecontent.p: The Weiss Collection is divided into six series based on subject. They are as follows: Acids, (1918-46), 1958; Maleic Anhydride, (1932-47), 1958 + [n.d.]; Patents, 1925-53; Phthalic Anhydride, 1936-61 + [n.d.]; Synthetic Phenol, 1925-56 + [n.d.]; and Addendum - John Weiss Notebooks, [n.d.]. Information on several companies for which Weiss consulted, such as the Pittsburgh Plate Glass Company and Reichhold Chemicals, Inc. is included. The addendum of notebooks, which was donated by Francis B. White independently of the rest of the collection, contains notes compiled by Weiss on chemical subjects of interest to him. The majority of the collection consists of progress reports and case studies, which Weiss generated as a result of his consulting practice. Working notes, data, correspondence, and patents are also present. His interests in Maleic Acid, Maleic Anhydride, Phthalic Anhydride, and Synthetic Phenol are well represented.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
